page.title: 14CHURCHES
page.content: The church at Shadforth is Anglican. It was built round about 1870. Shadforth church is quite small.There is a Salvation Army church at sherburn Hill.It is very big.It has a big hall and a small hall.Quite a few children go.This Salvation Army church has not been up very long.There used to be two chapels in square two.One was a Methodist chapel.There was a chapel at the east end of Sherburn Village. Worship in the area ha declined in the last 20 years, together with a general decline in the population. There is now no active place of worship in Ludworth ( although those that once were used are outside of the D block).
